title: Gateway Appliances docs
introduction: IBM Cloud Gateway Appliances are devices that give you enhanced control over network traffic, accelerate your network’s performance, and improve your network security. You can manage your physical and virtual networks for routing multiple VLANs, for firewalls, VPN, traffic shaping, and more.

section_recommended.title: Getting started with IBM Cloud Gateway Appliance
section_recommended.description: Learn how to get started using a gateway appliance and what the next steps are so you can dive deeper.

section_recommended.title: Ordering an IBM Cloud Virtual Router Appliance
section_recommended.description: The IBM Cloud™ Virtual Router Appliance (VRA) provides the latest Vyatta 5600 operating system for x86 bare metal servers. It is offered as a High Availability (HA) or standalone configuration, and lets you route private and public network traffic selectively, through a full-featured enterprise router that has firewall, traffic shaping, policy-based routing, VPN, and other features.

section_recommended.title: Ordering an IBM Cloud Junniper vSRX
section_recommended.description: IBM Cloud™ Juniper vSRX allows you to route private and public network traffic selectively, through a full-featured, enterprise-level firewall that is powered by JunOS software features, such as full routing stacks, QoS and traffic sharing, policy-based routing, and VPN.

tiles.title: Brocade operating system version 18.x
tiles.description: Version 18.x of the Brocade OS is now available for the IBM Cloud™ Virtual Router Appliance. Among other new features, this version provides remediation for the Spectre security breach.
